summary: Build "Covenant Chat" as a private two-user chat app with no accounts, using a shared password to unlock the chat (no real-time).
architectural_notes: Platform constraint: implement backend on Internet Computer (Motoko + React); no Firebase and no true real-time messagingâ€”use periodic refresh/polling.

existing_features.title: Make the app open directly to the chat experience with no login, signup, or authentication screens; the only gate allowed is a shared-password unlock step.
Implement shared-password access control: require the user to enter the shared password to view/send messages, and block read/write actions when the password is missing or incorrect.
Implement periodic refresh (polling) for new messages (not real-time): the chat view should fetch new messages on an interval and update the thread without requiring a manual refresh.
Build the two-person chat UI: sender messages aligned right labeled "You", receiver messages aligned left labeled "Partner", and show a timestamp for each message.
Add dark mode support and ensure the chat UI is clean, readable, and consistent across light/dark themes.

Apply a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and components) appropriate for a private chat app, and enforce it consistently across the unlock and chat screens (avoid blue/purple-dominant palettes).

new_feature_requests.summary: App opens directly to chat with no login/signup/authentication screens
Shared password unlock for both devices to access the chat (no accounts)
Two-user chat UI with "You" and "Partner" labels, sender right/receiver left, timestamps
Store chat messages in the app backend (Internet Computer canister) and refresh periodically (not real-time)
Dark mode support for the chat UI

Store chat messages in the Internet Computer canister and expose backend APIs to: add a message, list messages (optionally since a given message id/timestamp), and clear/reset chat history (admin via shared password).
